page.title: 13HIGH TOP OBSERVATORY.
page.content: The South-West Herts Astrological Society was formed in 1968 but has only been on it's present location since 1974.The society's observations are mostly planetary.Sometimes they watch meteors and sometimes they time them.In their possesion are several telescopes which can be adjusted to different magnifications.The minimum magnification is 228 times and the maximum magnification is 460 times.One of the telescopes is specially housed permanently.The housing has a removable window which enables the observer to observe the sky.The telescope is made from an old bedstead,tubing and a lamp post! There is another building which rotates on wheels.This building acts as housing for lots of other telescopes that are not fixed in any one position permanently.
